context.id: Add Local System Project to Remote Git Hub Repository
context.title: Git Hub Cheat Sheet
context.description: In order for us to push our local system project in to Github Repository we have to follow the below steps in sequencial order

command.label: 1) Initialize the local directory as a Git repository.
2) Add the files in your new local repository. This stages them for the first commit.
3) Commit the files that you've staged in your local repository.
4) In the Command prompt, add the URL for the remote repository where your local repository will be pushed.
command.serialization: git remote add origin remote repository URL

command.label: 5) Push the changes in your local repository to GitHub.
